column4: where can I find documentation on how to "backport" postgresql 8.3 to edgy?
How safe is it to update edgy to gutsy?
dependes on your configuration
: more specifically?
it'll work but you'll need to install 3rd party things
use apt-get only
so if I just put gutsy into my sources.list you reckon it will work with an update & dist-upgrade?
if you think that you'll save time than you should try
worked for me before
apart from openoffice I don't think it worth the upgrade
I want a newer version of postgres ...
fixes of what
: postgreSQL
install from source then
how do I tie a newer version of PG into the debian/ubuntu way of building things?
1 second
you can try to install the latests .deb
you mean d/l the 8.3 deb for gtsy and throw that at edgy?
shorter than upgrade
more stable process too, if you think server-wise
got gnome on that machine?
dpkg should work
